Detailed Description

MetaEngine Visitor that is used to retrieve the absolute position of a QWidget as a QPoint from a JSON object type in a metaengine::Doument.

The JSON data must be an object that has sub members named x and y, and optional members named origin_x and origin_y, which may be either integral or string type. The origin x and y values define what will be considered the origin of the widget to move, they default to 0,0 which is the top left of the widget.

Example:

"position":
{
"x": "50#",
"y": "50#",
"origin_x": "50%",
"origin_y": "50%"
}

The x and y values support the following syntax:

  • integral, string of integral type, or px suffix: The absolute pixel value of the position. Examples: 75, "200", "500px".
  • string with % suffix: The position is a relative percent of the widget's parent's position. Example: "50%" - the x/y position will be half of the parent's x/y position.
  • string with # suffix: The position a relative percent of the desktop's default screen's size. Example: "40#" - the x/y position will be 40% of the desktop's width/height.
  • string ratio: The x/y value is a percentage of the other x/y member. This means both x and y cannot both be ratios. Example: "1:3" - if this was set for x, the x position would be a third of the y position.

The origin_x and origin_y values support the following syntax:

  • integral, string of integral type, or px suffix: The absolute pixel value of the widget's origin from 0, 0 (top left corner). Examples: 20, "44", "0px".
  • string with % suffix: The widget's origin from it's top left corner as a percentage of the widget's size. Example: "75%".
